data.+1Code is a Social Impact EdTech prepari: Salaah Shots is a platform that enables community, peer mentorship, knowledge, and opportunities for doctors, and provides access to hospitals, pharmaceutical companies, and other healthcare stakeholders with the right doctors. It's a platform for doctors by doctors.
data.Mais1Code has developed a Social Impact:
Salaah Shots is lifting the healthcare by empowering doctors and breaking isolation between healthcare community.

Doctors and medical students often miss out on career opportunities, face professional and mental health challenges, and remain underpaid and overworked.  At the same time, 42% of hospitals in India are understaffed, and discovering the right doctors for hiring, research, or collaboration remains a critical challenge for hospitals, pharma, and other healthcare stakeholders.

Salaah Shots platform addresses this gap through two integrated layers:

EdTech Layer: A doctor-led community for peer mentorship, knowledge sharing, and continuous upskilling, fostering stronger professional networks.

HR Access Layer: An AI-driven discovery and collaboration engine that enables hospitals, pharma, and healthtech companies to connect with the right doctors faster and more precisely.

It's a platform for doctors by doctors
data.+1Code contributes to local economic dev:
Our model generates jobs at two levels:

Direct Employment: We hire developers, operations staff, and marketing professionals to build and run the platform.

Mentor Economy: We empower qualified doctors and educators to earn flexible income as mentors, researchers, case-discussions and course designers on our platform.
This dual impact supports both skilled youth in tech and medical professionals seeking supplemental income.
data.We operate in the fight against digital:
Research Access & Collaboration: Medical graduates often lack structured platforms to discuss research ideas or get guidance on publications. SalaahShots provides forums and mentorship channels to help doctors engage in evidence-based research discussions early in their careers.

Jobs & Career Guidance: Many MBBS graduates are underemployed or unsure about career paths. By creating a mentor economy and offering guidance on postgraduate paths, SalaahShots both generates flexible jobs for mentors and helps doctors plan their own careers.

Exam Preparation Gaps: High-stakes exams like NEET PG, FMGE, and UPSC CMS cause stress and inefficiency due to lack of analytics and personalized guidance. Our platform provides AI-driven test analytics, structured preparation plans, and expert mentorship to improve outcomes.

Patient Case Discussions: Doctors often have limited exposure to diverse clinical cases. Salaah Shots enables case-based discussions moderated by senior doctors, improving clinical reasoning and decision-making skills.
data.We develop partnerships with schools, NG:
Peer-to-Peer Learning: Doctors can share knowledge, notes, strategies for exams, research, case discussions, and opportunities creating a supportive learning environment.

Community-Driven Ecosystem: Users suggest topics for analytics, case discussions, and events(offline and online). This ensures the platform grows around the real needs of the medical student community. Verified mentors host live Q&As, patient case reviews, and research discussions, fostering direct interaction between experienced professionals and doctors.

Access to healthcare stakeholders: Hospitals, health-tech, and pharma and medical equipment companies can now easily access the doctor's community.

Inclusive Access: We focus on reaching Tier 2/3 cities, giving doctors who lack metro-level coaching access to the same community benefits.
data.We developed a flexible, digital, and re:
Salaah Shots began as a 1:1 mentorship service, helping individual medical graduates with exam strategies. Through continuous feedback and observing unmet needs, we expanded into long-term mentorship programs, supporting students throughout their entire preparation journey.

As demand grew, we started building a community space where students could exchange notes, join live webinars, discuss patient cases, and get guidance on research opportunities. Recognizing another critical pain point, we added interview preparation sessions for post-exam opportunities and built a college predictor tool to help students make informed decisions after results.

This evolution†”from one-on-one support to a holistic ecosystem†”demonstrates Salaah Shots ability to adapt, listen to its users, and scale its impact in real-time while staying true to its mission of democratising high-quality medical exam preparation and mentorship.
data.Dear Evaluators,\r\nWe are writing to sh:
Salaah Shots began with a simple yet powerful idea†”personalized mentorship for doctors. In less than a year, we have evolved into a comprehensive platform offering long-term mentorship programs, community building, interview preparation, college prediction tools, webinars, patient case discussions, and research guidance. By combining AI-driven analytics, mentor-led guidance, we are not only improving exam outcomes but also empowering medical professionals to earn flexible income as mentors.
Salaah Shots addresses deep-rooted inequities in medical education. High-quality coaching remains expensive and metro-centric, leaving doctors from Tier 2/3 cities and underprivileged backgrounds at a disadvantage. Our affordable, online-first model democratizes access to mentorship, and patient case discussions, research, enabling doctors nationwide to benefit from expert guidance. We also create flexible job opportunities for medical graduates re-entering the workforce as mentors, and research advisors†”building an inclusive knowledge-sharing medical community.

data.+1Code is a Social Impact EdTech prepari: We are an energy technology with prospective projects in smart energy management systems, green energy solutions and energy storage solutions. Our current main activity is the development of a smart energy management system that is meant to ensure efficient use of energy and local municipalities and power utilities full control of energy demand usage to prevent blackouts and saving of electricity to prevent burning of more coal to produce more electricity which contribute to greenhouse gases.
data.Mais1Code has developed a Social Impact:
An energy management system that is meant to ensure efficient use of energy and provide communities
and power utilities in developing countries with access to constant electricity supply, preventing blackouts/loadshedding and unnecessary production of more than enough electricity which most countries still depend on coal powered plants for generation contributing to greenhouse gases. The system is an
artificial intelligence driven technology comprising of an electrical smart meter connected to a central
system and a mobile App. It provides real time monitoring of every connected meter box in the area
through a central system by power utilities and local municipalities. The central system collects electricity
usage data from households and use AI to send alerts to communities through a mobile App when
electricity demand exceeds supply and advising which household appliances switch off. This prevents
load shedding, collapse of the grid and critical infrastructure damage while provide interrupted power
supply. It provides users with full access of their meter boxes from wherever they are in the world, where
they are able to monitor their electricity use from their smart phones and load vouchers from wherever
they are in the world. The system offers an anti-tamper mechanism of conventional prepaid meters that
are still commonly used in developing countries which affects the running of local economies, affect the
smooth provision of service delivery due to power cuts and leaves local governments and power utilities
with huge electricity debts. Conducted tests and research shows that implementing this smart artificial intelligence driven energy management system can save 20 †“ 30% of electricity ensuring constant supply, saving of the planet and access of electricity to all.

data.+1Code is a Social Impact EdTech prepari: We are a company that is looking forward to be part of the solution in combating on the issues of global warming and environmental challenges. By giving our community a alternative source of energy from the wood or coal that they currently sourcing from local forest which is causing deforestation and air pollution that also contribute to the climate change issues we facing on earth. Our alternative source of energy is by converting our local agricultural waste that is surrounding the community to a green clean energy that will protect the environment which is part of the SDGs goals.
data.Mais1Code has developed a Social Impact:
Biomass is all of the matter which is organic, contains carbon, and has gone through photosynthesis and other processes. Biomass is mostly made up of plants which make use of the light from the sun to create energy through photosynthesis many of the developing countries produce huge quantities of agricultural  residues but they are used inefficiently causing extensive pollution to the environment. The major residues are rice husk, coffee husk, coir pith, jute sticks, bagasse, groundnut shells, mustard stalks and cotton stalks. Sawdust, a milling residue is also available in huge quantity. 

By briquetting waste materials, volumes can be reduced by up to 90%. This creates a significant savings on transportation/handling/storage costs for later use as a heat source or simply for more convenient disposal. An additional advantage comes from briquetting flammable waste materials such as fine dust particles that are often created from wood processing operations. Briquetting eliminates the dust from the air and the mess created when removing dust collection bags, further reducing the risk of sparks or fire. 

Briquettes are immeasurably cleaner than the other fuel alternatives - especially coal! Therefore, government incentives that support briquetting systems and production along with dis-incentives for coal use make briquetting solutions extremely attractive. Plus, they don't create dust, and  briquettes burn in a controlled manner, slow and efficiently. They burn well in boilers and burners. More and more, utility companies are using biomass briquettes to supplement or replace coal as a solid fuel source.
data.+1Code contributes to local economic dev:
Our green charcoal briquettes project is designed not only to provide a clean, sustainable alternative to traditional charcoal but also to create meaningful jobs and stimulate local economic growth.
We aim to prioritise youth and women employment, offering training programs for:
Green manufacturing skills
Small-scale entrepreneurship opportunities (selling briquettes door-to-door or at community markets)
This will help reduce unemployment, particularly in rural and peri-urban areas.
By replacing traditional charcoal, we reduce deforestation and harmful emissions, contributing to healthier communities. This positions our workforce as active participants in climate change mitigation †” creating green jobs with long-term social value.
data.We operate in the fight against digital:
Deforestation & Environmental Degradation

Traditional charcoal production relies heavily on cutting down trees, leading to deforestation and loss of biodiversity.
Our green briquettes are made from agricultural and organic waste, reducing the need for wood and preserving forests.
Air Pollution & Health Problems:
Burning traditional charcoal produces high levels of smoke and harmful emissions, causing indoor air pollution and respiratory illnesses.
Green briquettes burn cleaner, producing less smoke and fewer toxins, improving household air quality and reducing health risks.

Waste Management Issues:
Organic waste is often dumped or burned, causing land pollution and releasing greenhouse gases.
We repurpose agricultural waste into briquettes, reducing waste in landfills and promoting a circular economy.

Energy Access & Affordability:
Many communities struggle with high cooking fuel prices or lack access to affordable energy.
Green briquettes are cost-effective and accessible, making clean energy available to low-income households.

Unemployment & Lack of Local Opportunities:
Rural and urban youth face limited employment opportunities.
Our production process creates jobs in waste collection, briquette production, packaging, and distribution †” empowering local communities.

Climate Change Impact:
Charcoal production and open burning contribute to greenhouse gas emissions.
By using renewable biomass and reducing tree cutting, our briquettes help lower carbon emissions and combat climate change.

Food Security & Sustainable Agriculture:
Crop residues are often wasted instead of being utilised effectively.
We create value from these residues, offering farmers additional income streams and encouraging sustainable farming practices.
data.We develop partnerships with schools, NG:
Our Green Charcoal Briquettes Project is designed to benefit the community at every stage of its value chain. We believe that involving local people not only strengthens our operations but also ensures that the environmental and economic impact is shared widely.

1. Job Creation and Skills Development

Local Employment: We will prioritize hiring from nearby communities for roles in production, packaging, distribution, and marketing.

Training Programs: Offer hands-on training in briquette production, safety, quality control, and basic business skills, empowering locals with long-term employment opportunities.

2. Support for Small Businesses

Partnerships with Retailers: Collaborate with local spaza shops, butcheries, and supermarkets to stock our briquettes, boosting their income streams.

Micro-Distribution: Enable small-scale entrepreneurs and youth groups to act as resellers, creating micro-enterprise opportunities.

3. Community Education & Awareness

Workshops & Demonstrations: Organize community sessions to showcase the benefits of green charcoal briquettes (cleaner burning, cost savings, and reduced deforestation).

Schools & NGOs Collaboration: Educate students about sustainability, recycling, and alternative energy solutions.

4. Environmental Stewardship

Tree-Planting Initiatives: Partner with schools and local organisations for tree-planting campaigns to replenish biomass sources and fight deforestation.

Waste Collection Partnerships: Engage communities in collecting agricultural waste or sawdust for briquette production, turning waste into income.

5. Social Impact and Inclusion

Women & Youth Empowerment: Intentionally recruit women and youth into leadership and operational roles.

Community Ownership: Explore co-operative models where a percentage of profits is reinvested in community projects (education, water access, etc.).
data.We developed a flexible, digital, and re:
Our green charcoal briquettes business is designed to remain resilient and adaptable in the face of changing market conditions, environmental challenges, and customer needs.

1. Operational Resilience

Local Sourcing: We rely on locally available agricultural waste and biomass, reducing vulnerability to global supply chain disruptions.

Scalable Production: Our production system can easily be scaled up or down depending on demand, ensuring we maintain efficiency while minimising waste.

Backup Energy Solutions: Where possible, we integrate renewable energy solutions (solar dryers, efficient stoves) to reduce reliance on unstable power grids.

2. Market Adaptability

Diverse Customer Base: We target multiple markets †” households, restaurants, butcheries, and retailers †” ensuring we are not dependent on a single buyer segment.

Flexible Packaging & Pricing: We offer packaging sizes suitable for both low-income households and bulk buyers, making our product competitive in multiple market segments.

Continuous Feedback Loop: We actively collect feedback from customers to adjust product quality, packaging, and distribution channels.

3. Environmental & Regulatory Adaptation

Sustainability Commitment: We continuously improve our production process to meet evolving environmental regulations and reduce emissions.

Innovation-Friendly: Our R&D team explores new briquette formulas and drying techniques to adapt to changing raw material availability.

4. Business Continuity & Risk Mitigation

Diversified Logistics: We establish partnerships with multiple transport providers to reduce risk of delivery disruptions.

Financial Resilience: By reinvesting profits and seeking grants, we maintain a healthy cash flow that can absorb short-term shocks.

Community Partnerships: Working with local communities helps us secure consistent raw material supply and build goodwill that protects the business in challenging times.
data.Dear Evaluators,\r\nWe are writing to sh:
Our green charcoal briquettes initiative represents a breakthrough in sustainable energy production and a practical solution to multiple social and environmental challenges. By converting agricultural and organic waste into high-quality briquettes, we reduce deforestation, minimize harmful emissions, and provide an affordable, clean-burning alternative to traditional charcoal. This innovation not only tackles climate change but also addresses waste management issues in our communities.

Our project is more than a product †“ it is a catalyst for social impact. We create employment opportunities for local youth and women, empowering them with skills in production, packaging, and distribution. Each bag of briquettes sold contributes to economic growth while promoting environmental stewardship.

The briquettes offer consistent heat, longer burn times, and reduced smoke, making them healthier for households and ideal for commercial users like restaurants, butcheries, and caterers. By making clean energy accessible and affordable, we are helping to improve public health and reduce the carbon footprint of daily cooking activities.

We believe this initiative deserves recognition because it demonstrates innovation, scalability, and measurable impact. Our model can be replicated across South Africa and beyond, creating a ripple effect of green jobs and cleaner communities. Winning this award would validate the hard work of our team, raise awareness about sustainable energy solutions, and inspire more businesses and individuals to transition toward eco-friendly practices.

Through passion, persistence, and purpose, our project is turning waste into opportunity and igniting change for a greener future.

data.+1Code is a Social Impact EdTech prepari: LiftUP Learning is an EdTech social enterprise addressing South Africa's biggest challenges: education inequality, gender inequality, and youth unemployment. Their AI-powered mobile app delivers adaptive, multilingual learning support, while the entrepreneurship program equips youth and women with business and digital skills. Through a sustainable hybrid model serving private schools and subsidising underserved learners, they combine impact with scalability. Led by a Founder recognised for transformative leadership, winning the BRICS CCI Women Empowerment GWLP Award and the BRICS WBA Women Contest, LiftUP unlocks self-employment, financial independence, and gender-inclusive growth, building a generation of future-ready leaders.
data.Mais1Code has developed a Social Impact:
LiftUP Learning is a mobile and web-based EdTech platform providing personalised academic support for students from primary school to high school covering both CAPS and IEB curriculum, with a strong emphasis on STEM and entrepreneurship. The AI-powered platform delivers adaptive lessons, curriculum-aligned quizzes, gamified engagement, and real-time feedback, enabling differentiated learning at scale. It includes dashboards for parents, educators and facilitators to monitor performance, identify gaps, and make informed interventions, easing the burden on overextended teachers.

Designed for accessibility and inclusivity, LiftUP is mobile-first, offline-capable, multilingual, and equipped with features for learners with disabilities. Its dual-track model combines academic support with hands-on entrepreneurship and digital skills training, empowering youth and women to launch ventures, improve employability, and achieve financial independence.

LiftUP operates as a hybrid social enterprise, generating revenue through private schools, homeschool networks, NGOs, and individual learners, while subsidising access for underserved communities. Its scalable technology and flexible deployment allow use in classrooms, community programs, and homeschooling setups. By digitising content and reducing reliance on paper, the platform also contributes to eco-friendly education delivery.

The platform's innovation lies in its integration of AI-driven personalisation, real-time analytics, and inclusive design to bridge education and digital divides. LiftUP fosters social impact by improving comprehension, retention, and accessibility, while simultaneously addressing youth unemployment and gender disparities through economic empowerment initiatives. With a sustainable business model, measurable impact, and scalable design, LiftUP Learning is transforming education delivery and preparing a generation of future-ready, economically active learners.

LiftUP Learning stands out for its inclusive, dual-impact approach. Unlike platforms that focus solely on academic tutoring, LiftUP combines AI-powered personalised learning with practical entrepreneurship and digital skills training, empowering youth and women to access economic opportunities. Its mobile-first, offline-capable, multilingual design ensures accessibility in low-connectivity areas and for learners with disabilities. The platform supports both individual and institutional deployment, allowing flexible use in classrooms, community programs, and homeschooling. LiftUP's hybrid social-enterprise model generates revenue while subsidising access for underserved learners, creating a sustainable, scalable solution that bridges education, digital, and economic divides.
data.+1Code contributes to local economic dev:
LiftUP Learning generates meaningful employment opportunities across South Africa through its dual-track EdTech model, combining academic support with entrepreneurship and digital skills training. The platform creates jobs directly by employing educators, content developers, AI specialists, app developers, and program facilitators, building a skilled workforce in both education and technology sectors. In addition, the LiftUP ecosystem supports indirect job creation by partnering with schools, NGOs, and community programs, training local facilitators to implement and monitor learning initiatives. These facilitator roles provide stable employment, professional development, and income in communities that often face high unemployment.

Beyond direct and facilitated employment, LiftUP fosters entrepreneurship and self-employment among youth and women. Its hands-on training programs equip participants with business planning, financial literacy, digital marketing, and critical thinking skills, enabling them to launch micro-enterprises or participate in the broader digital economy. data.+1Code is a Social Impact EdTech prepari: VGreEN Storage Solutions is South African startup pioneering safe, scalable, and sustainable energy storage using VRFB technology. VGreEN addresses the urgent challenges of unreliable electricity supply, rising electricity costs, and fire risks posed by lithium batteries. Our modular, locally manufactured systems provide firesafe, reliable power for rural microgrids, hospitals, telecoms, defence, oil & gas, mining, and microgrids. Recognized globally as a TotalEnergies Startupper Winner, Milken-Motsepe Green Energy Prize semifinalist and BRICS young Innovators Prize Finalist VGreEN is advancing Africa's energy resilience with strong partnerships, locally and abroad, and a long-term vision to establish South Africa as a VRFB manufacturing hub.
data.Mais1Code has developed a Social Impact:
VGreEN Storage Solutions introduces a groundbreaking green energy storage, that can be powered with Solar, Wind and also serve as a Behind the meter alternative to conventional lithium-based storage or backup batteries, through Vanadium Redox Flow Battery (VRFB) technology. Unlike lithium systems, VRFBs are non-flammable, have a 20+ year lifespan double that of lithium, and use fully recyclable electrolytes, making them the safest and most sustainable energy storage solution for critical sectors that have zero tolerance to fire safety. 

Our innovation lies in combining this proven technology with a unique business model, which includes localized manufacturing with over 60% South African content, Energy as a Service (EaaS) long term agreements with low rates, recurring revenue through high purity electrolyte leasing/recycling, 2 patents prepared for filing, and modular designs that scale from 5kWh (residential) to multi-MWh( Utility and Industries) applications. This ensures accessibility for rural areas, townships and fire safety with resilience for hospitals, telecoms, mining, defence and the oil and gas industries.

What distinguishes VGreEN is our integration of fire safety, local mineral beneficiation, and intelligent service delivery. While competitors rely heavily on imported lithium systems, we leverage South Africa's abundant vanadium mineral reserves, CSIR partnerships, Technology Innovation Agency (TIA) partnerships and bilateral research collaboration with China Utility company (CSG Power Generation) to create a sovereign and intentional qualities and skills to lead South Africa and Africa's High quality VRFB Original Equipment Manufacturers (OEM) homegrown solution. Supported by global recognition from TotalEnergies, Milken Institute, Stanford University and BRICS. VGreEN is uniquely positioned to transform Africa's energy landscape with safer, sustainable, localized and more inclusive storage solutions with focus on expanding local manufacturing value chains to create sufficient job opportunities for the youth, Women and Men of this country, while producing a value-added product to take to the global market.
data.+1Code contributes to local economic dev:

As we scale, our model emphasizes over 60% local content, unlocking opportunities across the vanadium value chain from beneficiation to assembly and maintenance.
VGreEN's vision aligns with key national policies, including the Black Industrialists Programme, the Industrial Policy Action Plan (IPAP), and the Integrated Resource Plan (IRP 2019), all of which prioritize local manufacturing, beneficiation of strategic minerals, and renewable energy integration. Furthermore, the Just Energy Transition (JET) framework and REIPPPP provide strong demand signals for long-duration storage solutions, while the South African Renewable Energy Masterplan (SAREM 2025) prioritizes vanadium redox flow batteries as a strategic advantage, promoting local OEM development, supplier clusters, and beneficiation.

By positioning South Africa as a global VRFB manufacturing hub and VGreEN as a quality OEM, this will generate hundreds of skilled and semi-skilled jobs, support township economies through decentralized deployment and services, while providing training and technology transfer through our China†“SA bilateral research partnership. and contribute to export competitiveness within SADC and beyond. This policy-backed growth ensures VGreEN plays a central role in South Africa's industrialization and green transition.

data.+1Code is a Social Impact EdTech prepari: Greentech Innovators is a forward-thinking provider of sustainable water management solutions, utilising advanced green technologies to address water scarcity and efficiency challenges. data.Mais1Code has developed a Social Impact:
Greentech Innovators has revolutionised water quality monitoring with its innovative product, Blue Lab, a portable and user-friendly water quality toolkit. Unlike traditional methods that require added chemicals and laboratory facilities, Blue Lab simplifies water testing by using a colour-change mechanism to indicate contamination. This makes it accessible to everyone, regardless of educational background. The toolkit delivers results within six hours, empowering individuals and communities with the ability to make informed decisions about water safety. By utilising recyclable materials, Blue Lab promotes sustainability and environmental consciousness.

The unique business model of Greentech Innovators centres on accessibility, sustainability, and community empowerment. By removing the need for expensive laboratories or highly trained personnel, it democratizes water testing, especially for marginalized communities in the Eastern Cape. Additionally, Blue Lab supports local municipalities in meeting the rigorous standards required for Blue Drop Certification, directly contributing to the region's water management goals. What sets Greentech Innovators apart from competitors is not only the technology's simplicity and speed but also its commitment to creating impact at the grassroots level, making a tangible difference in water quality monitoring for both urban and rural areas.

By offering a portable and chemical-free solution for water quality monitoring, Blue Lab minimises the environmental footprint associated with traditional water testing methods. Conventional water testing often relies on harmful chemicals and requires laboratory-based processes, which can be resource-intensive and polluting. In contrast, Blue Lab's use of recyclable materials not only reduces waste but also ensures a more eco-friendly approach to water quality management. Its rapid results help identify contamination early, enabling faster remediation and preventing further environmental degradation, particularly in water-scarce areas like the Eastern Cape.

The simplicity of Blue Lab's colour-change technology ensures that water testing is accessible to all, regardless of educational background or technical expertise. Whether someone has attended school or not, they can use the toolkit to assess water quality, empowering marginalised communities with the knowledge and tools to safeguard their health. This inclusion helps bridge the gap between under-resourced communities and access to safe, clean water, addressing disparities that often leave rural and low-income populations vulnerable to waterborne diseases.

Beyond its environmental benefits, Blue Lab addresses the societal challenge of water access and quality in underserved regions. In the Eastern Cape, where municipalities face significant challenges in maintaining safe water standards, Blue Lab helps local authorities achieve Blue Drop Certification, which is a key indicator of water quality and safety. By ensuring better water management practices, the product contributes to improved public health outcomes, reducing the prevalence of waterborne illnesses and improving overall quality of life.

Furthermore, by providing local job opportunities in manufacturing, training, and distribution, Greentech Innovators fosters economic inclusion and supports community resilience. The company also encourages sustainable practices in its supply chain, which has a cascading positive effect on local ecosystems and economies.

data.+1Code is a Social Impact EdTech prepari: YHonk Tech is a social impact startup dedicated to reducing honking noise pollution. It uses patented IoT technology to enforce Section 194(F) of the Motor Vehicle Act, promoting quieter cities. With over 150 devices piloted across India, YHonk has partnered with city traffic police and major organizations like Uber, TSRTC, Zydus, and Intas. The company's efforts have been recognized by the UNDP and HYSEA, demonstrating strong traction as it works to improve urban mobility and public health.
data.Mais1Code has developed a Social Impact:
YHonk's innovation lies in its patented first-in-class IoT hardware technology that directly addresses the challenge of honking noise pollution, a largely neglected but critical urban health and mobility issue. The device installed inside the horn circuit of target vehicle, it then detects, records, and reports honking violations in real time, enabling city traffic police departments to enforce Motor Vehicle Act 2019 Section 194(F) effectively within silent zones. Unlike conventional approaches that rely on manual monitoring or awareness campaigns, YHonk provides data-driven enforcement and actionable insights through its connected platform.

Its unique business model combines collaboration with city traffic police departments under PPP model on pilot basis, to establish its capability. And then on sale basis to scale. Partnerships with corporates to deploy devices on fleets and employee transport, aligning regulatory compliance with corporate ESG commitments. This dual-market strategy ensures sustainable adoption, scaling, and social impact.

What sets YHonk apart is its blend of social impact, patented IoT innovation, and policy enablement, making it the only solution in its sector that not only reduces noise pollution but also creates a measurable ecosystem for healthier, quieter, and more livable cities.
data.+1Code contributes to local economic dev:

In the long run, YHonk's business model, spanning public-private partnerships and corporate ESG initiatives, supports a sustainable employment ecosystem, combining urban innovation with social impact. data.+1Code is a Social Impact EdTech prepari: At Yotuh, we are solving the problem of low cold chain penetration in India by making it accessible, affordable and sustainable for all. Currently, every refrigerated truck uses fossil fuel directly or indirectly to power the refrigeration. Extensive use of these fossil fuel based systems results in high fuel consumption, high engine idling and reduction in vehicle performance as well as life. Existing systems fail to refrigerate Small Commercial Vehicles and EVs, creating a huge gap in intra-city logistics. With our fully-electric refrigeration solution we are solving these problems and empowering the Indian Cold-chain stakeholders.
data.Mais1Code has developed a Social Impact:
Our product is 100% electric refrigeration for cold chain logistics vehicles. These vehicles are used to transport goods like Ice-creams, meat, fruits & vegetables, frozen food, dairy products, vaccines & other pharmaceuticals. Our product is vehicle independent as it is powered by a separate Li-ion battery. It has standby cooling modes, live monitoring and preventive maintenance facilities.

For our customers, our system saves 75% of the refrigeration running expenses and increases their profit margins to 2x. The TCO of our system is 35% less than the existing systems. We are the first one to enable the small cargo vehicle owners to convert their vehicles into refrigerated ones and cater the rising supply chain of perishables and frozen food in the intra-city delivery market. With our system, ANY type of SCV as well as EV 3W/4W can be refrigerated! which was not possible until now. Our single unit is capable of offsetting 3000+ kgs of CO2 annually and EVs enabled by our solution can offset 4 times more carbon.

We are the first one to provide the Electric refrigeration system with a vehicle independent architecture. What differentiates our product from the competitors is our self developed- Adaptive Cooling Controls (Patent-pending). Adaptive cooling controls dynamically controls the system optimizes it for the maximum cooling run-time and multi-point deliveries, making our unit most energy efficient with lowest Rs./km running cost.
data.+1Code contributes to local economic dev: By enabling small commercial vehicles, we are bringing down the upfront cost to get a refrigerated vehicle. We are promoting the use of cold chain in mid-mile delivery segment. With the growth of quick commerce in India and increased organization in retail, the demand for cold chain is increased on the other hand, the existing players are not equipped with the right tools to cater to this demand. We are reducing the economical and technological barrier to enter this segment which indirectly results in more profit creation and more business development.
data.We operate in the fight against digital:
As a clean tech start-up, we have social & Environmental impact as our focus. 
With existing solutions, small commercial vehicles and EV 3W/4W are not able to get refrigerated. Hence, perishable producers have no option but to pay high costs for cold chain vehicles. Now, many small scale producers and retailers can not afford this cost, and tend to use cheap alternatives like Dry Ice and Insulated boxes which further limits them to expand their business and ensure the quality of food. With our solution, we are enabling Micro-entrepreneurs to get into cold chain by reducing the required investment to have a cold chain vehicle as well as by making it accessible to SCVs and EVs which is further reducing the overall transportation cost by 25-30%. Our solution is bridging the gap by enabling the unserved small scale perishable producer to increase their profits and business by making cold chain transportation accessible and affordable to them.

Currently, the smallest available active refrigerated vehicle in the market is Bolero/Dost (8ft size). The existing Carrier/Thermoking systems attached with such vehicles have an average consumption of 3-4L of fuel per day. In some cases like Bangalore in peak traffic time, it goes up to 5L a day! If we talk about bigger vehicles (20-40ft) where such AC systems are operated with a separate diesel engine which keeps on running for days sometimes, the fuel consumption of such AC systems is 3-4L per hour! 

In terms of savings, we are saving the fuel by switching from fossil fuel driven AC systems to our Electric AC system. Annually, our AC system is capable of saving ~930 L of fuel. Additionally, by enabling SCVs and EVs, which are further fuel efficient and 0 emission vehicles respectively, overall we help save ~2000 L to ~4000 L of fuels respectively with CV and EV refrigerated vehicles (savings combined of vehicle+AC). That is equivalent to saving ~5 tons and ~11 tons of CO2 per vehicle per year. And this impact is just with our smaller product, if we are to extrapolate the CO2 reduction capabilities just with our AC unit, it ranges from 3 to 36 tons per system per year.

With our Made in India product, we are eliminating the use of fossil fuel and increasing the cold-chain penetration in India to ensure food security. We are focusing on SDG Indicators 2.3.2, 9.2.1, 9.4.1 and 12.3.1 for our Impact measurement.
data.We develop partnerships with schools, NG:
Aligning with Made in India, Made for World, we are building Yotuh with an aim to remove the hardware dependency on foreign countries and create employment in India. Currently 95% of our components are sourced from India and in next 2 years we are aiming to make it 100%. 
Our solution plays critical role in maintaining the cold chain between the Production and Consumer. In Mid-mile, where the cold chain penetration is less, has a higher chance of goods spoilage. The same solution can be replicated to power the mobile Milk Chillers and agricultural produce collection units which will help connect the small and marginal farmers living in inaccessible areas. We are already planning to working on such concepts with the national bodies of India.
data.We developed a flexible, digital, and re: With the growth of perishables, the need for cold chain logistics has increased. But Indian Cold chain segment lags behind in terms of infrastructure and sustainable technologies. This is where Yotuh Energy is bringing a change by equipping the logistics players, small business holders and individuals with smart, more efficient and sustainable technologies to make their business climate resilient and to satisfy the need of the industry. Our solution comes with a web-app monitoring tool to remotely monitor the temperatures of the container as well as the location, battery percentage and system health. The temperature reports can be automatically generated which can be shared with the end user. The system adapts as per the operational conditions (Ambient temp., Delivery points etc.) in order to maximize the efficiency and run-times. With vehicle independent structure, the system can be used with any type of vehicle (Diesel, Petrol, CNG or EV). It can even be retro fitted onto the existing vehicles of the transporters.
data.Dear Evaluators,\r\nWe are writing to sh:
With our Made in India product, we are eliminating the use of fossil fuel and increasing the cold-chain penetration in India to ensure food security. We are focusing on SDG Indicators 2.3.2, 9.2.1, 9.4.1 and 12.3.1 for our Impact measurement. 

So far with our innovation, we have delivered more than 300 tons of Perishables with 0 food loss (because of cold chain failure), our vehicles have covered more than 180,000 kms, resulting in offset of 18,000 tons of CO2. We are very early in our journey where we have deployed 15 units to the customers but with our plans to expand and scale up, the impact number will also climb high.

To develop this technology, we have been supported by following organizations in terms of financial support, mentorship, pilot support and market support-

Ministry of Agriculture & Farmers welfare - RKVY Raftaar program (Through PABI)
Dept. of Science & Technology - NIDHI Prayas & NIDHI EIR Program (FiiRE & IIM Udaipur)
Ministry of Electronics and Information technology - TIDE 2.0 EIR Program (IIM Visakhapatnam)
Acumen: Energy for sustainable livelihood fellow (Winner of the TA grant as well)
Incubation Support - IIT Madras Incubation cell and Daimler India Commercial Vehicles
Technical Assistance grant from Nexus program (funded by US Embassy to India)
Carbon Zero Challenge 4.0 winner (IIT Madras)
The Fishtank innovation award (Aquaconnect)
The startup tech pioneer award (IIT Madras Incubation Cell)
The next startup dragon award (Ivy Cap Ventures)
